questions.text: The 4077th is under the gun, with bombs literally pounding the compound.  Radar is on the phone with a disbelieving officer, pleading for some relief.  According to Radar, has anyone been wounded in the bombing?
questions.explanation:
Yes.

	As a matter of fact, Radar reports three people wounded.  The 4077th has also lost its generator and its water tank.  Despite these facts, the officer on the phone with Radar insists, in a very condescending tone, that there is no bombing in the area.  When Radar sticks the telephone out the window of the office to let him hear the noise, the telephone is blown to smithereens.

questions.text: In the O.R., the hospital staff works feverishly despite the bombing.  One Spanish speaking nurse named Sanchez has a very difficult time with the situation, and screams quite a few times.  Where is Nurse Sanchez from?
questions.explanation:
Costa Rica.

	Played by Louisa Moritz, this is Nurse Sanchez's only appearance on the show.  According to my research, no Costa Rican citizens participated in the Korean War.  However, it could be that Sanchez had immigrated to the United States, and then volunteered to serve in Korea.

questions.text: While Hawkeye and Trapper toil away in the O.R., the latrine is hit by a bomb.  Henry Blake was in the latrine at the time.  Who else was in there with him?
questions.explanation:
Father Mulcahy.

	The doctors pull Henry and Father Mulcahy from the wreckage.  Both appear to be soiled, but okay.  Apparently, it was a freshly dug latrine.  Lucky for both of them!

questions.text: It turns out that the shelling that is occurring at the 4077th is coming from American artillery batteries.
questions.explanation:
True.

	Radar is able to get ahold of the officer he spoke with before once again.  This time, the officer is willing to concede that the 4077th is indeed being shelled.  On top of that, he reveals that the bombing is the responsibility of the Americans.  Before Radar can truly give him a piece of his mind, the phone is once again cut off.

questions.text: Margaret and Trapper are trapped in the supply shed during the chaos.  While in the supply shed, Trapper reveals that he has an 'old football injury'.  What type of 'injury' is this?
questions.explanation:
Hemorrhoids.

	Trapper's football injury, namely hemorrhoids, came from sitting for long periods of time on the bench.  While Trapper and Margaret are in the supply shed, things become very cozy, they even share a blanket, but nothing ever happens between them.

questions.text: Henry is interested to know what the movie will be that evening.  The camp needs a morale boost.  When he discovers that it's another war movie, he's very disappointed.  Father Mulcahy claims that he had made an attempt to get what kid's movie, but failed?
questions.explanation:
The Yearling.

	Father Mulcahy describes 'The Yearling' as being about a boy and his pet deer.  When Henry hears about this he claims that his Cousin Floyd had the same kind of relationship with a goat.  Frank submits that his uncle had a similar rapport with a mule.

questions.text: After Margaret and Trapper are rescued from the supply shed, Frank is terribly jealous.  Margaret fuels the fire by describing Trapper has having which of the following qualities?
options: A tall, quiet dignity and strength about him
questions.explanation:
A certain 'je ne sais quoi'.

	Frank is very peaved to learn that Margaret has spent such a long time in the supply shed with one of his sworn, mortal enemies.  After Margaret utters that French-derived phrase to describe Trapper, Frank knows there is a problem...she's talking dirty in 'Spanish'.

questions.text: In the face of Trapper's 'challenge' to her love, and in order to secure Margaret's love for himself, Frank actually says 'I want to marry you' to Margaret.
questions.explanation:
True.

	Indeed.  Frank essentially proposes to Margaret in this brief moment, but when she insists that he repeat himself, he clams up.  Margaret is so upset that she screams 'You weasel!' and boots him out of her tent.  When she comes looking for Frank later on, he pretends that he is not in the Swamp.

questions.text: Radar plays the radio over the intercom to assuage the bomb-weary personnel at the 4077th.  The problem is that the music program is being Deejayed by one of the enemy.  What is the name of this 'Seoul City' siren?
questions.explanation:
Seoul City Sue.

	Like Axis Sally and Tokyo Rose, Seoul City Sue bombarded American soldiers with anti-American propaganda during the Korean War.  It seems the real Seoul City Sue was an American woman who had married a Korean man, and was possibly being forced to broadcast.

questions.text: Radar comes over the P.A. system to read a letter from his beloved mother.  His reading is cut off just as he is about to announce something about which of his cousins?
questions.explanation:
Ernie.

	My goodness, Radar has a big family, which seemingly extends beyond just human kind.  In the letter, his mother answers a series of questions about Radar's extended family and pets.  We don't hear the questions, only the silly answers.  Hawkeye is disappointed not to hear about Radar's cousin Ernie.  Radar stops reading the letter when the bombing begins anew. Thank you for playing this quiz, I hope you have enjoyed it!
